website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys AC2400 Dual Band Wi-Fi Router (E8350) delivers very good 2.4GHz throughput and fast file transfers. It's equipped with the latest Wi-Fi technology, but its 5GHz throughput is only middling, and it's not cheap.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Quad band and Mimo if that means anything to you helps speeds up internet access and has improved my Wi-Fi coverage/reception. Needed a few firmware updates before use. Been regularly having dropouts and the wan connection stops working with a BT Openreach modem quite often, so I have to reset it. This is getting tiresome now. Setup and menus are OK but not as good as Asus.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Rose

customer_reviews.title: A good router
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews of this router on Amazon, I thought this router may have been a bit of a lemon, but after reading some other reviews on other sites saying it was pretty good, I went ahead and bought it. For me, it has been a great buy. My wireless signal is so much better throughout my house. It is a bit big, but it looks ok. I don't mind that there are no status led's on the front. I am glad I bought this router. I give it four stars only because of the size. Operation wise it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Redmill

customer_reviews.title: Linksys (E8350) Router! 👎
customer_reviews.text: Worker for afew hours before locking up, can't obtain IP errors plagued all my devices! :( ... Reinstalled my ea6700 (with previous firmware) & everything returned to normal! :) ... Immediately sent back to Amazon for refund! :)
customer_reviews.author: SimonB79

customer_reviews.title: Wifi issues
customer_reviews.text: Great delivery of the router but it's always droping out or freezing on the wifi. Linksys tec advice did not resolve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Henwood

customer_reviews.title: A router (not a modem) that does the job well
customer_reviews.text: First thing to note is that this is just a router - it does not include a modem. Some reviewers seem to have had difficulty because they didn't grasp this. You will need to connect this to your modem (supplied by your ISP) or it will not connect to the internet. It has excellent range and speeds across the house, as you'd expect with the multiple antennas. Although disappointingly, it was only marginally better than the ISP-supplied router I had previously. So perhaps better for larger houses with multiple users, which would benefit from the enhanced range and capacity this router supplies. It is a pain to set up and the instructions are not great - but they always are.
customer_reviews.author: kinggx

customer_reviews.title: What am I doing wrong?!
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with this product. It seemed to keep bumping me and my housemates off the wifi and locking us out. As a result I had to keep rebooting the system just to connect to the internet. Now I just don't bother. When it did work I have to say it was pretty good. I can't help thinking that I was doing something wrong somewhere, but according to the instructions you pretty much just plug it in and away you go. Perhaps it's better if you work in an office and have IT support, but for me I just couldn't figure out what the configuration issue was and that's a bit of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: setup issues but otherwise good
customer_reviews.text: It took a while and a fair few calls to my provider to set up this router, but once we got it working, it worked well and with a good and stable connection. The range is OK for my small flat, but it wouldn't be ideal for a big place as the signal disappears as soon as I leave the flat or go to the balcony which didn't happen with my old - fairly basic - router. It's VERY big so it doesn't fit in the usual location on the wall which is annoying, but I guess that's necessary with its range of features A good product that works well after some false starts
customer_reviews.author: JMB1779

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a two storey house with three bedrooms, it's moderately sized and this little gadget has been enough to boost the wi-fi connection significantly. It's a bit of a pain that you need a desktop or laptop to set it up (especially when I imagine a lot if homes are now exclusively using tablets and phones) so this is something to bear in mind. All in all though, easy to use and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Durston

customer_reviews.title: Good strong signal working over 2Gs or 5GS
customer_reviews.text: Good strong signal working over 2Gs or 5GS. Was fairly easy to setup and wifi worked well over playstation, iPad and computer. Made of good quality plastics so could probably take a fair few knocks. And no noticeable drop in signal so far. Range is decent but I live in a small place so not sure how it fairs in a larger home but I expect it will do well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C. J. Thorpe

customer_reviews.title: Macho networking!
customer_reviews.text: Solid, with a build quality that suits those men-folk who like things to look... 'manly'... all dark and serious with things poking out... Its works well, setup is relatively easy, the esata socket proving useful is allowing a speedier option to portable hard drive access. Overall, I think Batman would like it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: We have a three-storey house and often have a poorer signal on the top floor. This has improved this a little bit. Not significantly enough for the cost of the item though I feel. It was however easy to setup and straightforward to use so no complaints on that front. Ok but that's all really.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leckie

customer_reviews.title: Fast but massive
customer_reviews.text: Very fast router, makes internet much much quicker so I'm very happy with this product. However it is massive and takes up a lot of room so that is a downfall. Overall very good though.
customer_reviews.author: I Like Cheese

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router.
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys WiFi Router is a powerful bit of kit. It is relatively easy to set up and works well throughout out the house and a bit beyond. It appears to have good security features too.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Top drawer router if you want all possible features and wavelengths.
customer_reviews.text: Top drawer router if you want all possible features and wavelengths. Very well made and robust
customer_reviews.author: Gary White

customer_reviews.title: Impressive looking bit of kit, it eventually works out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Impressive looking bit of kit, it eventually works out of the box, but some work has to be done to configure it, from my PC. However the wi-fi range is awful. I use my wireless routers from the study, above the lounge, in order that radio signals only have to pass through the wooden floor. Unfortunately the signal parses out randomly. The Virgin super hub provides a better signal. Reading other views, I see almost everyone has similar or worse problems, which is worrying.
customer_reviews.author: CjW & KjW

customer_reviews.title: Hmm.
customer_reviews.text: If you're in need of a good router then this would be the one. Most routers that are supplied by Internet providers are adequate enough for purpose, but you can always go one better, and this is definitely a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: J-Mac

product_meta.title: Linksys E8350 Advanced Dual Band AC2400 WiFi Router with Gigabit Ethernet (1.4 Ghz Processor, 4x4 AC, USB 3.0, USB 2.0/eSATA, MU-Mimo)
product_meta.description:
Enjoy fast wireless Internet speeds and improved range and performance with the Linksys AC2400 Dual Band Gigabit Wi-Fi Router. Great for gamers, and well-suited for homes with several people on the Internet at once, this dual-band Wi-Fi router uses 4x4 Wireless-AC (802.11ac) technology to produce four independent streams of data at once to increase speed and reduce lag and buffering. MU-MIMO ready* and featuring a 1.4 GHz dual-core processor, the EA8350 is designed to handle high-bandwidth activities and heavy network traffic.

Simultaneously delivers four independent streams of data at speeds up to 2.33 Gbps**--six times faster than Wireless-N. View larger.

Upcoming MU-MIMO technology will allow streaming and gaming on multiple devices without lag.* View larger.

Four Gigabit Ethernet ports offer transfer speeds up to 10 times faster than Fast Ethernet. View larger.

4X4 AC FOR FAST WIRELESS PERFORMANCE
The Linksys AC2400 Dual Band Gigabit Wi-Fi Router features 4x4 Wireless-AC (802.11ac) technology that is up to six times faster than Wireless-N.** Unlike traditional routers that deliver two or three data streams, the EA8350 delivers four simultaneous, independent streams of data at speeds of up to 1733 Mbps. The result is seamless Wi-Fi performance and better range that is ideal for gaming and video streaming on multiple devices. 

DUAL BANDS AND FOUR ANTENNAS FOR WI-FI COVERAGE
The E8350 has dual wireless bands of 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz and can deliver combined data transfer speeds of up to 2.3 Gbps (AC1733 + N600 Mbps) for a strong, reliable Wi-Fi signal over a wide range. Four external antennas project large, overlapping Wi-Fi patterns to eliminate dead spots and improve coverage. As a result, you can enjoy online gaming or video streaming without lag or buffering. The antennas are adjustable for optimal positioning. 

MU-MIMO-READY FOR FAST SPEEDS ON MULTIPLE DEVICES
Built for high-bandwidth activities and heavy network traffic, the E8350 is equipped to handle MU-MIMO technology (multi-user, multiple-input, multiple-output) that enables people on the network to stream and game using multiple devices simultaneously. MU-MIMO can effectively triple the throughput of a Wi-Fi device, allowing for three times the number of users without any loss in speed. 

1.4 GHZ DUAL-CORE PROCESSOR TO SURF, STREAM, AND GAME SIMULTANEOUSLY
Featuring an enterprise-class 1.4 GHz dual-core processor, the E8350 maximizes throughput to both wired and wireless devices, making it ideal for streaming HD videos, playing online games, downloading or transferring large files, or performing other high-bandwidth activities. Unlike typical single-core processors -- which have to switch between data streams--a dual-core processor can handle multiple data streams simultaneously for better efficiency and performance. 

BEAMFORMING FOR STRONG, FOCUSED WI-FI CONNECTIONS
The E8350 features beamforming, an innovative technology that strengthens the wireless signal to specific devices within its range, rather than simply sending out Wi-Fi in a general direction. Beamforming also reduces interference from other devices for stronger Wi-Fi connections. So whether you're on a smartphone, a tablet, a Wi-Fi-enabled camera or camcorder, or a wearable computer, you can move about your home and access the Internet with confidence. 

USB 3.0, ESATA, AND GIGABIT ETHERNET PORTS TO SHARE FILES
The E8350 comes equipped with a variety of leading technologies that make it easy for you to transfer and share files across your wireless network. On the back of the router are four Gigabit Ethernet ports, which are 10 times faster than traditional Fast Ethernet to provide the fastest wired speeds. To stream or send large files across your network at high speed, you can connect a flash drive to the USB 3.0 port or an external SATA storage device to the unique eSATA port. For printing or working with smaller files, the eSATA port also serves as a USB 2.0 port. 

WIRELESS SECURITY TO BLOCK UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS
Like other Linksys wireless networking products, the E8350 features Wi-Fi Protected Setup along with WPA/WPA2 encryption and an SPI firewall to keep your home Wi-Fi network safely connected and secure. 

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
This product requires a Wi-Fi-enabled computer that runs Microsoft Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista SP1 or later, Windows 7, or Windows 8 operating system or the Mac OS X Snow Leopard 10.6.1 or later, Lion 10.7 or later, Mountain Lion 10.8 or later, or Mavericks 10.9 or later operating system. 

AC2400 DUAL BAND GIGABIT WI-FI ROUTER
AT A GLANCE:
 * 4x4 Wireless-AC delivers four independent streams of data simultaneously
 * Dual wireless bands (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz) for combined speeds up to 2.3 Gbps (AC1733 + N600 Mbps)**
 * MU-MIMO-ready* to handle high-bandwidth, multi-user activities
 * 1.4 GHz dual-core processor for streaming, downloading, and more
 * USB 3.0, eSATA, and Gigabit Ethernet ports for wired connections

*May require a software/firmware update to be made available for download at linksys.com/support. 

**Maximum performance derived from IEEE Standard 802.11 specifications. Actual performance may vary, including lower wireless network capacity, data throughput rate, range and coverage. Combined Wi-Fi speeds of 802.11ac 2300 Mbps (for two 5 GHz and one 2.4 GHz bands) is up to 2x faster physical data rate when compared to 802.11ac 1600 Mbps Wi-Fi routers. An 802.11ac adapter may be needed to achieve 11ac data rates. In order to achieve the best performance, router must be used with a compatible AC1300 wireless device. 



BOX CONTAINS
1 x Linksys EA8350 Dual Band AC2400 Gigabit Smart Wi-Fi Router with Gigabit (1.4Ghz Dual Core CPU, 4x4 AC, USB 3.0, MU-Mimo ready) - EA8350-UK
feature_bullets: 4x4 Wireless-AC delivers four independent streams of data simultaneously
Dual wireless bands (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz) for combined speeds up to 2.3 Gbps (AC1733 + N600 Mbps)
1.4 GHz dual-core processor for streaming, downloading, and USB 3.0, eSATA, and Gigabit Ethernet ports for wired connections
